sourceMeaningMnemonic: A <radical>tsunami</radical> hits a <radical>roof</radical> and then <radical>correct</radical>s itself. This causes it to swirl around, creating an <kanji>eddy</kanji>.
meaningInfo: An eddy requires water to change direction and then twirl around, and when the tsunami hits the roof, that's exactly what it does.
readingMnemonic: There is a person trying to create an <kanji>eddy</kanji> with a tsunami, and when their roof correction device is shown to be effective, they sing: "This is how <reading>you do</reading> (<ja>よど</ja>) it."
readingInfo: Imagine them singing this, emphasizing the "you do" part of the song as they watch the eddy being formed.
